meanings.definition: The act of taking money out of a bank account.
meanings.sent1: I made several withdrawals from my bank account to pay for my new computer.
meanings.sent2: She needed to make a withdrawal to get cash for the concert tickets.
meanings.sent3: After making too many withdrawals, I had to start saving more money.
meanings.sent4: Her withdrawals from the bank account left her with little savings for emergencies.
meanings.sent5: The withdrawals from the ATM were quick and convenient.

meanings.definition: The act of removing troops or equipment from a military position.
meanings.sent1: The withdrawals of troops from the battlefield signaled the end of the conflict.
meanings.sent2: The general ordered a strategic withdrawal to regroup the soldiers.
meanings.sent3: The withdrawals of tanks and artillery surprised the enemy forces.
meanings.sent4: The sudden withdrawals of troops caught the enemy off guard.
meanings.sent5: The withdrawals of equipment were done under the cover of darkness.

meanings.definition: The symptoms experienced when stopping the use of a drug or substance.
meanings.sent1: He experienced severe withdrawals after quitting smoking cold turkey.
meanings.sent2: The withdrawals from the drug were so intense that he needed medical help.
meanings.sent3: Her withdrawals from caffeine made her feel tired and irritable.
meanings.sent4: The withdrawals from the medication caused him to feel dizzy and nauseous.
meanings.sent5: The withdrawals from the substance were a challenging hurdle to overcome.
